title: U.S. Air Force’s X-37B spaceplane lands following 434-day orbital mission
summary: The secret winged spacecraft launched on a SpaceX Falcon Heavy rocket on Dec. 29, 2023 to conduct a classified mission. The landing concludes the seventh flight of the Boeing-built spacecraft since 2010.

title: UK Awards £65M Contract for BOREALIS Space Monitoring and Control System
summary:
The UK government has awarded CGI UK a £65 million contract to develop the BOREALIS command, control, and data processing system for the National Space Operations Centre. Initiated in 2023, the BOREALIS project aims to develop a system capable of processing and collating information across multiple classifications, up to Top Secret, to monitor the space […]
The post UK Awards £65M Contract for BOREALIS Space Monitoring and Control System appeared first on European Spaceflight.

summary: "It would be nothing short of an extinction-level event for space science."

title: Hubble Spies a Spiral in the Water Snake
summary: This NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope image of a vibrant spiral galaxy called NGC 5042 resides about 48 million light-years from Earth in the constellation Hydra (the water snake). The galaxy nicely fills the frame of this Hubble image, while a single, foreground star from the Milky Way shines with cross-shaped diffraction spikes near the galaxy’s […]

title: ESA and GSMA Foundry empower industry to achieve seamless global connectivity
summary: At MWC25 Barcelona, the European Space Agency (ESA) unveiled a funding initiative, promoted in partnership with GSMA Foundry, to support projects aimed at integrating satellite and terrestrial networks for seamless connectivity.
